overview:
Dale Stinton is the President of Second Century Ventures and the Chief Executive Officer of the NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF REALTORSÂ®. He oversees every investment made out of the Second Century Ventures fund and provides the assurance that each portfolio company will also be supported by NAR.

In addition to the strategic insight of NAR, Dale brings to Second Century Ventures deep industry expertise, relationships and experience in venture investing. During his career, Dale has served as CFO, CIO and CEO of NAR. Dale has been directing strategic investments within NAR since becoming CFO in 1991 and oversaw key investments for NAR including Move, SentriLock, RE FormsNet (now ZipLogix), and eProperty Data. Dale also oversaw the development, financing and construction of NAR’s new $47 million award-winning Washington, D.C., office building and the establishment of the $52 million Strategic Investment Reserve.

Dale worked with NAR leadership to set up the RealtorsÂ® Housing Relief Fund and has managed the REALTORSÂ® Relief Foundation. He is a Certified Association Executive (CAE), Certified Public Accountant (CPA), a Certified Management Accountant (CMA), and has achieved the REALTORÂ® association Certified Executive (RCE) designation. He earned his M.B.A. from DePaul University and his B.S. from Western Illinois University.
